trans-unit.source: Represents an abstract class that Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) derives from <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to do serialization and deserialization.
You can derive from this class to do other functions than serialization.
Note that there is a known issue with the normalization of linefeed characters inside of CDATA sections that you may encounter.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> class.
Invoked only by its derived classes because this class is abstract.
This property always returns `false`.
Its derived classes can override to return `true` if they support canonicalization.

Returns `true` if and only if this derived class of <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter> can canonicalize the XML content being written to it, according to the Exclusive XML Canonicalization rules as defined in [Exclusive XML Canonicalization Version 1.0](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96655).
`false` in all cases.
Creates an instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> that writes [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] binary XML format.
The stream to write to.
An instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref>.
Creates an instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> that writes [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] binary XML format.
The stream to write to.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionary"></xref> to use as the shared dictionary.
An instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlBinaryWriterSession"></xref> to use.
`true` to indicate that the stream is closed by the writer when done; otherwise `false`.
An instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref>.
Creates an instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> from an existing <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref>.
An instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref>.
An instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref>.
writer is `null`.
Creates an instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> that writes XML in the MTOM format.
The stream to write to.
The character encoding of the stream.
The maximum number of bytes that are buffered in the writer.
An attribute in the ContentType SOAP header.
An instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref>.
Creates an instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> that writes XML in the MTOM format.
The stream to write to.
The character encoding of the stream.
The maximum number of bytes that are buffered in the writer.
The content-type of the MIME part that contains the Infoset.
The MIME boundary in the message.
The content-id URI of the MIME part that contains the Infoset.
`true` to write message headers.
`true` to indicate that the stream is closed by the writer when done; otherwise `false`.
An instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref>.

The text writer writes the XML in UTF-8 format.
The stream to write to.
An instance of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref>.

When implemented by a derived class, it stops the canonicalization started by the matching <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter.StartCanonicalization(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean,System.String[])"></xref> call.
This method is not yet implemented.
Method is not implemented yet.
When implemented by a derived class, it starts the canonicalization.
This method is not yet implemented.
The stream to write to.
`true` to include comments; otherwise, `false`.
The prefixes to be included.

Asynchronously encodes the specified binary bytes as Base64 and writes out the resulting text.
To use this method, you must set the <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.Async%2A> flag to `true`.
Byte array to encode.
The position in the buffer indicating the start of the bytes to write.
The number of bytes to write.
The task that represents the asynchronous `WriteBase64` operation.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> asynchronous method was called without setting the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.Async"></xref> flag to `true`.
In this case, <xref href="System.InvalidOperationException"></xref> is thrown with the message "Set XmlWriterSettings.Async to true if you want to use Async Methods."

The local name of the element.
The namespace URI of the element.
The element content.

The element content.
Writes the current XML node from an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref>.
`true` to copy the default attributes from the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
reader is `null`.
Writes the current XML node from an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref>.
`true` to copy the default attributes from the `XmlReader`; otherwise, `false`.
reader is `null`.
Writes out the namespace-qualified name.
This method looks up the prefix that is in scope for the given namespace.
If the namespace maps to the current default namespace, no prefix is generated.
When writing attribute values, this method generates a prefix if the namespace is not found.
When writing element content, it throws an exception if the namespace is not found.
The local name of the qualified name.
The namespace URI of the qualified name.
localName is `null`.
Writes the start of an attribute with the specified local name, and namespace URI.
The local name of the attribute.
The namespace URI of the attribute.
Writes the start of an attribute with the specified prefix, local name, and namespace URI.
The namespace prefix.
The local name of the attribute.
The namespace URI of the attribute.
Writes the specified start tag and associates it with the given namespace.
The local name of the element.
The namespace URI of the element.
The writer is closed.
Writes the specified start tag and associates it with the given namespace and prefix.
The prefix of the element.
The local name of the element.
The namespace URI of the element.
The writer is closed.
Writes the given text content.
The text to write.
Writes the text node that an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> is currently positioned on.
If positioned on element content, this method advances the XmlDictionaryReader.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to get the text value from.
`true` to indicate that the reader is positioned on an attribute value or element content; otherwise, `false`.
Writes a <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> value.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> value to write.
Writes a <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> value.
The <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> value to write.
Writes a value from an <xref href="System.Xml.IStreamProvider"></xref>.
The contents of the stream provided by the `IStreamProvider` are written as Base64 data, unless this method is overridden in a derived class.
For the asynchronous version of this method, see <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter.WriteValueAsync%2A>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.IStreamProvider"></xref> value to write.
value is `null`.
value returns a `null` stream object.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> method was called before a previous asynchronous operation finished.
In this case, <xref href="System.InvalidOperationException"></xref> is thrown with the message "An asynchronous operation is already in progress."
Writes a Unique Id value.
The Unique Id value to write.
value is `null`.
Writes a <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryString"></xref> value.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryString"></xref> value.
Asynchronously writes a value from an <xref href="System.Xml.IStreamProvider"></xref>.
This is the asynchronous version of <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter.WriteValue%2A>, with the same functionality.
To use this method, you must set the <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.Async%2A> flag to `true`.
The <xref href="System.Xml.IStreamProvider"></xref> value to write.
The task that represents the asynchronous `WriteValue` operation.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> asynchronous method was called without setting the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.Async"></xref> flag to `true`.
In this case, <xref href="System.InvalidOperationException"></xref> is thrown with the message "Set XmlWriterSettings.Async to true if you want to use Async Methods."
Writes a standard XML attribute in the current node.
The local name of the attribute.
The value of the attribute.
Writes an XML attribute in the current node.
The local name of the attribute.
The value of the attribute.
Writes a namespace declaration attribute.
The prefix that is bound to the given namespace.
The namespace to which the prefix is bound.
namespaceUri is `null`.
Writes a namespace declaration attribute.
The prefix that is bound to the given namespace.
The namespace to which the prefix is bound.
namespaceUri is `null`.
